H0.text: Water heated by solar panels comes from a renewable source of energy that Mrs. Moyers teaches her students about.

H1.text: Food cooked over natural gas is the example of a renewable energy source that Mrs. Moyers presents to her students when she teaches them about different energy sources.

H2.text: Electricity produced from coal is the example that comes from a renewable source of energy taught by Mrs. Moyers about different energy sources.

H3.text: An engine powered by gasoline is the example that comes from a renewable source of energy as taught by Mrs. Moyers to her students about different energy sources.

A4.text: Solar power, wind power, hydroelectricity, geothermal energy, and biomass are widely agreed to be the main types of renewable energy.

A5.text: Renewable energy often displaces conventional fuels in four areas: electricity generation, hot water/space heating, transportation, and rural (off-grid) energy services.
